section: "CUSTOMERS" means all users who access Co-Branded Site and complete at least one transaction per month.
explanation: The definition of 'CUSTOMERS' requires completion of at least one transaction *per month*. This creates an internal contradiction because users who complete one transaction but not necessarily every month would be customers, making the definition's ongoing monthly requirement unclear and unenforceable.

section: i-Escrow may place banner advertising on the Co-Branded Site upon prior written approval of 2TheMart, which shall be at the discretion of 2TheMart.
explanation: While 2TheMart has discretion, I-Escrow shall not run banner advertisements on the Co-Branded Site for any of 2TheMart's competitors. 2TheMart shall provide in writing, a list of companies they would like to exclude, including every time they wish to change this list. This section is a structural flaw because there should be a 'shall' after 'discretion of 2TheMart'.

section: After the Launch Date, i-Escrow shall pay 2TheMart advertising fees based on the number of Transaction Inquiries. This advertising fees shall consist of a per Transaction Inquiry amount calculated by multiplying 0.025% by the amount of the average Transaction from all Customers in the preceding quarter.
explanation: The calculation of advertising fees based on '0.025% by the amount of the average Transaction' is ambiguous. It's unclear what exactly the 0.025% is taken from, the whole transaction or a part of it. Also, there is ambiguity in the calculation - multiplying a percentage by an amount does not compute.
